stories.text:
Seems to me that "World of Warcraft" is pretty much a metaverse already with multi-dimensional, cross realm instances etc., and considering Battle.net's VOIP features, I can't figure out what META can offer that is not possible with BLZ. already. Other than a bit of code for a headset (Probably already exists in an addon...I haven't checked) and maybe a subscription free F2P scheme.

Is it possible that M$ is just waiting for the right time to enter the fray?
stories.title: Ask HN: HN â€“ Will M$ counter META with a BLIZZARDesqq universe of their own?

stories.text:
Godel showed that it is impossible to formally prove the consistency of a system of arithmetic WITHIN that system of arithmetic.

Given a static system that is clearly true.

However, I claim a self-modifying system can extend itself to "look down" on the initial system of arithmetic.

I'm not sure how to show this yet. My intuition is leaning toward using the standard trick of towers of types. Is it possible to show a system of arithmetic is consistent using higher order types?

Which raises the question of self-modifying Turing machines. This leads to the concept of a meta-Turing machine.

Not only must the "instructions of the machine" be "on the tape" so they can be modified but the "structure of the hardware" also has to be "on the tape" so that changing the "structure" changes the way the machine operates. A simple implementation can be created in an FPGA which generates modifications to its own Verilog definition and reloads itself, becoming a fundamentally different machine.
stories.title: Godel's Proof
Nannou: An open-source creative-coding framework for Rust
